summary: Enhancing DEX and ELF analysis capabilities with a focus on accurate parsing, unified 32/64-bit support, and detailed JSON reporting.

work_items.description: Corrected logic for encoded_class_data and code_item to ensure all methods in a DEX file are processed accurately.
Reduced false positives in DEX analysis rules using string comparison fixes and null checks. Implemented single-pass detection to avoid duplicates.
Implemented a flexible JSON reporting system. Added 'source_file' and 'evidence' fields to findings to provide forensic context.
Refactored ELF analysis to support both 32-bit and 64-bit shared objects using a unified path (normalizing headers to 64-bit structures).
Implemented global counters for unsafe function usage. Findings are now aggregated across all scanned .so files to reduce report noise.
Fixed critical bugs in hash matching: memory leaks during DB loading, incorrect loop bounds using sizeof(pointer), and SHA-256 buffer/logic errors.
Integrated DEX and ELF report propagation. Added cleanup or post-processing triggers (execve delete.sh).
Created comprehensive project documentation including installation guides, build instructions, and troubleshooting.

recent_changes.modification: Added execve('delete.sh', NULL, NULL) at program exit.
Added .json pattern to exclude local report files from version control.
Implemented db_loaded flag and global counters for actual hash counts.
